intro: Gutierrezia tortosae, commonly known as the desert gorse, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow, fluffy flower heads that bloom in late summer. The plant has small, needle-like leaves and is adapted to arid environments, making it drought-tolerant. It plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and provides forage for wildlife. Gutierrezia tortosae is often found in chaparral and desert scrub habitats.
